text: Bangladesh competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Swimming== Bangladesh entered three swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Juwel Ahmmed |align=left|50 m backstroke |29.33 |62 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m backstroke |1:05.00 |62 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Md Ariful Islam |align=left|50 m freestyle |24.92 |92 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m breaststroke |1:07.74 |78 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Junayna Ahmed |align=left|50 m freestyle |30.96 |86 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|200 m butterfly |2:34.95 |32 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships Category:Bangladesh at the World Aquatics Championships World Aquatics Championships
title: Bangladesh at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
